title: Understanding Complicated Grief
text: Complicated grief is more than just feeling sad after a loss. It involves a deep and prolonged emotional response that can affect daily life.

title: Characteristics of Complicated Grief
text: Consider how complicated grief differs from normal grief. It often involves intense longing, difficulty accepting the loss, and a sense of disbelief.

hintAnswer: profound and prolonged response to loss that impacts a person’s ability to move forward
title: Identifying Complicated Grief
text: Which of the following best describes complicated grief?
choices: Nurses can engage in open and compassionate conversations to explore these existential concerns, helping individuals use their spirituality to find purpose and meaning in their lives, even in the face of mortality
natural emotional response to loss, which is often most powerful when an individual loses someone or something deeply important to them
a type of grief that is not openly acknowledged or socially supported
profound and prolonged response to loss that impacts a person’s ability to move forward
